Uses of Vector3 in game.framework
 

Methods in game.framework that return Vector3
static Vector3 Vector3.add(Vector3 veca, Vector3 vecb)
          Performs Vector3 Addition on two Vector3 and returns a new Vector3
static Vector3 Vector3.clamp(Vector3 vec, Vector3 min, Vector3 max)
          Clamps a Vector3 between a min Vector3 and a max Vector3 and returns the modified Vector2
static Vector3 Vector3.crossProduct(Vector3 u, Vector3 v)
          Performs the cross product between 2 Vector3 You have u = {ux, uy, uz} You have v = {vx, vy, vz} Then uxv = (uyvz - uzvy, uzvx - uxvz, uxvy - uyvx)
static Vector3 Vector3.max(Vector3 veca, Vector3 vecb)
          Returns a Vector3 that contains the highest value from each matching pair of components.
static Vector3 Vector3.min(Vector3 veca, Vector3 vecb)
          Returns a Vector3 that contains the lowest value from each matching pair of components.
static Vector3 Vector3.negate(Vector3 veca)
          Returns a new Vector3 pointing in the opposite direction.
static Vector3 Vector3.normalize(Vector3 vec)
          Normalizes a input Vector3 and returns a new Vector3 that is normalized
static Vector3 Vector3.one()
          Returns a spcial type of Vector The one vector (1,1,1)
static Vector3 Vector3.reflect(Vector3 incident, Vector3 normal)
          r = 2 * (I.N) * N - I I is the incident vector N is the normal dot() is the dot product
static Vector3 Vector3.scalarMultiply(Vector3 veca, float scalar)
          Multiplys a Vector3 by a scalar and returns a new Vector3.
static Vector3 Vector3.scalarMultiply(Vector3 veca, int scalar)
          Converts an int to float for scalar multiplication of a Vector3.
static Vector3 Vector3.subtract(Vector3 veca, Vector3 vecb)
          Performs Vector3 Subtraction on two Vector3 and returns a new Vector3
static Vector3 Vector3.unitX()
          Returns the unit vector for the x-axis.
static Vector3 Vector3.unitY()
          Returns the unit vector for the y-axis.
static Vector3 Vector3.unitZ()
          Returns the unit vector for the z-axis.
static Vector3 Vector3.zero()
          Returns a special type of Vector The Zero vector also known as the null vector (0,0,0)
